lines.text: To hear a human voice and trust that it comes from a human who is made like me, to touch a pair of lips and at the same time know that it is a pair of lips.
You become grateful for the horrors you're familiar with. The unknown horrors are worse.
Why must I always have a guilty conscience?
My legs aren't there. Could someone get them over there in the corner and put them back on?

Do you think I'm emotionally crippled for life? Do you think we're a million army of emotionally crippled people, wretches who wander around shouting to each other with words we don't understand and that makes us even more scared?
I hate you, you fucking witch.
If you force things to be as usual, they'll be as usual. Don't you think?
